Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 09:56AM migallen wrote: I decided on having a BMX with permanent implants put in immediately.  the cancer was only in one breast, but I decided, hey if I'm going to go down this road, then I'm only going to do it once. So, yes I had the BMX with implants put in (No TEs) because I went from a 36dd to a B cup.  It's been 13 days since my surgery and I do feel some discomfort, but the pain is bearable, especially with all of the meds my docs have given me. My surgeon says no radiation for me, but I do meet with oncologist on Friday to be put on tamoxifen and whatever else she feels I may need.  Luckily, we did not get a lot of push back from my health insurance company, they have been pretty good. Lizzymack, I hope you are doing ok? How are things for you now? min
Posts.Title: Who decides whether you qualify for a BMX? pejkug3 littleamazon

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 10:25AM migallen wrote: Also, I am so glad that I stuck to my guns, because the BS wanted to do a lumpectomy with snd and I said No, do the bmx.  So, during the surgery, she was able to get a 2mm clear margin up to the chest wall.  So, I am so happy that I did not let anyone make me double guess or doubt my original choice. best to you all min
Posts.Title: Who decides whether you qualify for a BMX? pejkug3 littleamazon

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 01:29PM migallen wrote: uh-oh, am I doing something wrong Maria?  I have a port and my physical therapist at the Cancer Institute is having me do arm curls, row-like exercises and the plank (yoga) and other upper body exercises.  I wonder if maybe I shouldn't be working my upper body.  Although I prefer to work the lower body. How are you doing?  I finally got the anti-cancer book in the mail on Saturday. hugs, Min
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2011 02:45PM migallen wrote:
Posts.Title: My MRI Results migallen julie75

Posts.Content: migallen wrote: Ok, I need to take a very deep breath.  My BS just emailed me saying that she viewed my MRI, she also said that the 1 cm mass (we already know that one is cancer)  has a 3cm surrounding enhancement around it, and that 3cm could be cancer.  OK!  What does that even mean???? Is my cancerous tumor 1 cm or is it 3cm now? And wouldn't the MRI be able to say definitively if the 3cm surrounding enhancement is cancer?   Have any of you ladies received this type of dx?  I'm not sure why she's only giving me part of the dx, maybe she's waiting for our next appt on january 7.  This waiting su*ks big time.  Thank you all for reading, my thoughts go out to all of you.  I feel like you all are my life line Min bmx w/recon on 1/27/2011. Start 4 cycles of AC on 3/18/11. Followed by 12 weeks of Taxol. 33 rads Dx 12/17/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2010 09:39PM migallen wrote: Thank you Taranebraska, Julie and Beacon, I see the BS this Friday.  I know that my pathology report also stated other grayish areas.  I think you all for you support and I know that I will get through this.  I'm so thankful for all of the support I have found on this site.  Happy New Year to you all, Min
Posts.Title: My MRI Results migallen julie75

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 02:49PM migallen wrote: Well, I was just reading my MRI report and in the comments section there's a statement that says "slightly prominent Left Axillary Lymph Node".(My cancer is in my left breast). Does anyone know what that statement means? The size is 1.5 cm x .9 cm.  I'm hoping that my worst fears aren't coming true.  Oh well, just one more thing that I need to battle I guess. Min
Posts.Title: My MRI Results migallen julie75

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 11:06PM migallen wrote: Thank you Julie, boy it just seems like something new just keeps popping up, and I just have to deal with it as I go along. The bmx with recon went really well, it was over in 2 1/2 hours. unbelievable.  I hope you are all well, Min
Posts.Title: My MRI Results migallen julie75

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2011 07:39AM migallen wrote: Well, I had a bmx in January and at that time my surgeon said I would not need to do radiation or chemo.  However, after the surgery was completed, I was told that I would have to have both chemo, followed by radiation. Chemo because my onco type number was 30, radiation because the cleanest margin they could get was .2 mm.  Have you asked your dr about getting the oncotype dx?  I don't regret my decisions, you just have to throw everything you can at cancer to beat it down. Oh and I am 47.  Best of luck to you, Min
Posts.Title: have idc - radiation? yes/no bethannhg Curlylocks

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 07:12PM migallen wrote: I had my bmx with immediate recon on 1/27/2011 and did not need assistance what so ever when I had to use the rest room, I was able to wipe myself.  Huge relief. I too suffered from constipation afterwards, but trust me, prune juice worked for me, not the stool softeners.  Just know that you will do fine.  It's the unknown that always freaks me out. best of luck to you, min
Posts.Title: The little details after mastectomy fluffqueen01 JO-5

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 11:07AM migallen wrote: Thank you Lovegolf, 1badboob, Barbe and Michelle, yes, I will also to reconstruction after the BMX, but I am still waiting on my tests to see if it's in the nodes.  I've looked in my closet and have decided that I need to move all of my button up shirts and pants on the bottom rack for easy access.  I can't thank you all enough for your answers and suggestions and Lovegolf, I will definitely go to the salon to get my hair done, that's a great idea.  OK, so I will give up control and allow others to help, I know they want to help, but it's hard for me to accept it.  But I will, thank you ladies so much. Ah, I think I'll also have to sleep on the couch downstairs or have a recliner moved upstairs. Min

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 06:21PM migallen wrote: Hi Geogal, My BS had recommended lumpectomy with snd for me.  However, i flatly said no, thank you I'd prefer a bmx because my cancer was grade 3, strong family history and very dense breasts.  I don't regret my decision.  I'm the type of person that wants to get everything done at once. So I figured, if I'm going to do this, I'm going to do this once.  But that was my reason. Each person has their own personal reasons, and please make sure that you choose the decision that is right for you.  I wish the very best for you, Mignon

Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2011 10:05PM migallen wrote: Hi ladies, I am back home.  Had the bmx with recon yesterday.  Everything went smoothly.  Ithought it was going to be a 6 hour procedure, but it was over in 2-3 hours.  I'm now a full b cup, used to be a double d. Ok, I did experience nausea and vomiting, so they gave me something for that.  I was given percoset for the pain, but it didn't really help, so they now have me on valium and hydromorphone and it works great. also am on antibiotics. They did a lympocentogram, and guess what?  they did the wrong side, so I had to have done again on the correct side.  Honestly, that wasn't painful for me.  I haven't been able to eat much.  The ps says my drains can come out on monday, thats only 5 days from surgery. yay. All the stuff I packed, I didn't even use.  I'll keep you posted on more, good luck to all, Min
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2011 07:43PM - edited Jan 31, 2011 07:44PM by migallen thank you fuzzylemon for posting, I would be interested in anything you'd like to share.  I think everyone here will listen. Sue I am still loopy.  My kids just smile at me and tell me that they love me.  I tried to tell them of my angel story, but they are skeptics and I really believe that there was an angel by my side that day 5 days ago, taking away my pain and helping my surgeons as my bmx with recon was over in 2 1/2 hours. cindy in NM that is an amazing story in the recovery room, I hope you are ok now? we are strong women, we are warriors and we are survivors. Let us not forget that. edited for wordiness :) Diagnosis: 12/17/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2-
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 03:57PM migallen wrote: hi mdg and supersally, I finally got my drains out today 12 days after surgery. 1 drain felt uncomfortable, but the other I didn't feel a thing. Well, I meet with my oncologist this friday.  I think it's because my clear margins were something like 2mm to the chest wall.  I will know more later. All I want to do is sleep.  I can't eat, although I did eat about 1 cup of food during superbowl yesterdaY.  Supersally, what worked wonders for me was prune juice, boy did that work :). How are all of you ladies doing?  Anyone gone back to work? I'm going to try to stay out for another 3 weeks just to see how I do on that chemo. Redsky, why is there a delay? thinking of you all mignon
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2011 11:04PM migallen wrote: Ugh, today is my last radiation treatment, 33 in all.  Yes I have severe burns from radiation.  I would categorize it as 2nd degree burns.  I am experiencing bleeding under the breast area.  I was given hydrocodone for the pain and silvadene for the burns.  Are they helping?  Just a little bit.  I'm extremely uncomfortable, but what the heck, I have to get through it right?  thanks, Min
Posts.Title: Severe radiation burns to the breast RCindy

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 02:45PM migallen wrote: Thank you Vikki.  How is your day coming along? Ladies I know how you feel, you want everything to be ready and perfect before you go in, that's the  wanting to take care of everything side of us women.  I told my fiancee that I needed to clean the kitchen and he said, no, don't do it.  Your famiily and friends want to contribute, they need to contribute, so let them clean the kitchen (there's like 10 dishes in the sink). Ladies, everything will be fine.  The hard part for us, is to allow others to take care of us when we've been taking care of everyone else.  I go in in 3 days.  I'm doing ok right now.  Although today seems to whizzing by and I wish it would slow down a bit. I like what you wrote Sue, just keep on swimming.... Min
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 04:55PM migallen wrote: Well, I'm ready as I'll be for my surgery tomorrow.  I did spend a great morning with my 14 yo dd, we shopped some, painted our toes and she helped me get a room ready for my incoming family.  I've been pondering what about this journey scares me the most, and I've decided that being a control freak, my control is going to be taken away from me while I'm in surgery for 6 hours.  There won't be any more last minute checking in here to see, "oh what does this mean", etc.  I hate that I will feel as vulnerable as a child.  I know my surgeons will do a wonderful job. I'll try to post tomorrow morning before I go in, I have to be there at 6:00 am.  Ladies, I'll be checking in on you all later.  Min
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 11:45PM migallen wrote: Ladies having surgery this week, I wish you all good luck.  I too am having problems with going "poop", my last resort now is prune juice.  I had the bmx with recon on Thursday and am now cutting back on the pain meds.  The PS wants to remove the drains tomorrow, so I will definitely take the pain meds for that, as I hear it is uncomfortable. I did unwrap my ace bandage to take a quick peek at my new breasts, and even though they sit up high on my chest for right now, they look pretty good. My advice to you ladies is please get plenty of rest, don't over do it, just because thepain starts to ease off a little.  relax and let others spoil you.  I cannot tell you, how blessed I feel, I just never knew how many people actually cared about me. Barbara, redskyatnight, slinky and Dmho, you ladies will be in my thoughts tomorrow.  You will all do great. Min

Maybe that's not the case for others? min

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 01:25PM migallen wrote: Jackie, I'm so sorry to hear of your pain and sorrow.  But if you feel like crying then let go and cry and scream if you have to, you will feel better.  My dr gave me xanax the day she gave me my dx because I wasn't sleeping.  Its been 15 days since my bmx with permanent implants, the drains are gone, but I still have not driven and I still can't sleep on my sides.  I try but it is much too painful.  I see the onc today for the first time, another fun day! Ladies, we are getting through this and we will get through this with the love and help from our friends and families and especially you all since we all know what we're facing. Mignon
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2011 02:13AM migallen wrote: I saw the onc today for the first time.  I really thought she was going to recommend chemo, but so far she's not.  She is ordering oncotype dx testing that will test my tumor to see what the chances are of me developing cancer again.  I will also be seeing a radiologist soon.  So basically, more waiting around for me. Yuck.  I have to admit, it was weird sitting in the waiting room because I was the youngest person there (even though I don't consider 47 young).  I'm 15 post bmx with immediate recon and I still am having pain and discomfort, but it is nothing like it was a week ago. sweet dreams to all Mignon

My best to all of you ladies. Min
